parameters.definition: Number of newspapers a labrador can deliver at a time
Number of bone treats required for a labrador service
Number of newspapers a golden retriever can deliver at a time
Number of bone treats required for a golden retriever service
Total number of small bone treats available
Minimum number of golden retrievers that must be used
Maximum proportion of dogs that can be labradors

description: A dog school trains labradors and golden retrievers to deliver newspapers. A labrador can deliver \param{LabradorNewspaperCount} newspapers at a time and requires \param{LabradorBoneTreatCount} small bone treats for service. A golden retriever can deliver \param{GoldenRetrieverNewspaperCount} newspapers at a time and requires \param{GoldenRetrieverBoneTreatCount} small bone treats per service. The school only has \param{TotalBoneTreatsAvailable} small bone treats available. In addition, at least \param{MinGoldenRetrievers} golden retrievers must be used and at most \param{MaxLabradorProportion} of the dogs can be labradors. How many of each dog should be used to maximize the number of newspapers that can be delivered?
